plugins.name: Instagram Multi Post Divider
plugins.description: Instagram Multi Post Divider is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of creating Instagram posts. With just a few inputs, you can generate a main frame of any size, filled with your design, and automatically divide it into perfectly square sub-frames ready for export. The plugin ensures precise alignment and includes a customizable dead zone to avoid cropping important content. Ideal for designers who want to create multi-post Instagram carousels with minimal effort, allowing you to focus on creativity while the plugin handles the technical details.

plugins.name: GlobalLink Strings Localization Plugin
plugins.description:
GlobalLink Strings is a localization management platform for continuous software localization projects. It is designed to automate localization tasks for developers and offers business users a single place to manage all parts of the localization and translation workflow in as much detail as desired.


Learn more on the GlobalLink Strings website: globallinkstrings.com


GL Strings and Figma

The GL Strings Figma plugin makes it easy to start your translation process already in the design stage and uses the text elements and layouts in your Figma file as the starting point.


As a designer, you can easily collaborate with your product and developer teams on GL Strings without any back and forth or the need to convert your designs into any other format.


You can simply upload everything, all texts as well as screenshots via the plugin. On GL Strings the screenshots serve as valuable context for your translators.


In Short

1) Upload all your text from Figma to GL Strings

2) Generate screenshots of your designs and upload them too.

3) Download translations from GL Strings to preview them in your designs

4) Move your text and translations over to the app after the design phase is done via GL Strings


You can find the full Figma plugin documentation here https://www.globallinkstrings.com/docs/integration-documentation/figma


This plugin requires a GL Strings account. Sign-up for free here

https://dashboard.globallinkstrings.com/!/#/signup
plugins.tagline: Automate the translation process of your Figma projects

plugins.name: Lasca - No more frontend-coding
plugins.description:
No more front-end coding by integrating Figma with React/vue.js/webpack


Lasca is a new type of no-code platform designed for developers to automate front-end coding for not only static websites but also production applications, and build them dramatically faster.


No-code is generally considered to be skeptical and not developer-friendly because of its technical debt and high learning and switching cost. However, Lasca enables front-end automation in a completely developer-friendly way through the following approaches.



How it works


1. Convert Figma designs including responsiveness to HTML & CSS perfectly


Lasca converts not only visual elements but also responsive web design using Figma’s constraints and auto layout precisely.


2. Configure UI logics & interaction with APIs


Lasca allows you to configure UI logics (condition, loop, variable, event) and interaction with API. They are essential to web applications.


3. With combination with your own coding, there is nothing you can’t build


Converted code will be automatically inserted into your frontend code in the place of lasca tag ( <lasca></lasca> ) through your build process with webpack.


Lasca does not control entire our vue.js project. It is incrementally adoptable. You can choose to automate the front-end using the lasca tag or code it yourself in various ways.



Get started


You can test Lasca quickly using Get started guide here.



Resources


You may find certain features do not export correctly. Please reach out to a list of limitations of Figma export here. Also, if you encounter any bugs, please let us know and we'll be able to fix it rapidly :) You can contact us from here.

accepted.description: Just import Figma. No more frontend-coding - HTML & CSS

plugins.name: Copy handover (extractor)
plugins.description:
No more having to tediously copy every text field 🎉


With two simple clicks, you can now extract all your text from a selected frame, group, component or instance. 😎


How it works:

  • Select an item
  • Click the extract button
  • Copy to clipboard as plain text or a markdown table


Designers & Writers, you can now display your copy in a structured manner that improves efficiency and limits mistakes.


Engineers, if your handover is done in Figma, you can now extract all the text and efficiently transfer it over to your repo in one go.


What is a markdown table?

A Markdown table is a way to present data in a tabular format using plain text that can be rendered in HTML It is most commonly used in the software delivery tools you know such as Gitlab and Jira.


Feedback

This initial release is considered a BETA version with lots of room for improvement. For any feedback, suggestions or bugs... please email hello@mrshibumi.co.za


Known bugs

  • List item numbers and bullet points are not being extracted (Fix in progress)


Disclaimer:

Plugins only work for users with edit access, so engineers with view only access unfortunately cannot leverage this awesome timesaver. 😔
plugins.tagline: A simple & efficient way to extract and prepare text for handover

plugins.name: RenameGPT
plugins.description:
RenameGPT 🤖


✨ Transform Your Figma Workflow with Smart Layer Renaming! ✨


RenameGPT is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly renaming layers within a selected frame.


Simply select your frame, and with one click, a screenshot along with the list of layers is sent to ChatGPT, which then intelligently renames each layer for you.


Features:

  1. Smart Layer Renaming: Automatically renames layers in a meaningful way using ChatGPT.
  2. Easy to Use: No prompts, no hassle. Just select your frame and let the plugin do the magic.
  3. Time-Saver: Focus on design, not on tedious renaming tasks.


Roadmap:

🔜 Upcoming Features:

  1. Better Error Handling: Improved stability and handling of edge cases.
  2. Custom Parameters: Set custom naming conventions to suit your project needs.
  3. Additional Settings: More control over how layers are renamed, including exclusion of certain layers or groups.


Get started with RenameGPT today and transform how you manage layers in Figma! 🎨
plugins.tagline: Rename layers in a click with RenameGPT – effortless, smart, and instant.

plugins.name: Split Anything
plugins.description:
Split any type of layer into multiple columns and rows. A useful tool for efficient design work.


Sometimes we refer to it as dividing, splitting, separating, segmenting, or something similar.


🔑 Key Features


  1. Universal Compatibility: Split any type of layer from frames, groups, components, instances, shapes, and more.
  2. Real-Time Preview: Visualize your splits instantly within the plugin interface.
  3. Preserve Original Styling: Maintain the integrity of your design after splitting.
  4. Flexible Customization: Fine-tune with adjustable gutters and margins.


💡 How It Works


  1. Select any layer you want to split.
  2. Open the plugin and set your desired columns and rows. Fine-tune gutters and margins as needed.
  3. See your split in real-time inside plugin before applying.
  4. Click on Split Anything or use shortcut ⌘ + Enter (Mac) / Ctrl + Enter (Windows) to apply. Happy splitting!


🎨 Inspiration


I've been a huge fan of the Split Shape feature when designing in Sketch. After migrating to Figma, I discovered a similar plugin by Gaddafi Rusli, also called Split Shape. I've used it extensively, but sometimes faced issues with visualizing the split process and encountered occasional bugs. This inspired me to recreate the plugin while learning to code, aiming to add real-time preview functionality and ensure compatibility with various layer types.


👍 Like this? Tip me at coff.ee/afnizarnur
plugins.tagline: Split any type of layer into multiple column and rows.

plugins.name: Codia AI VectorMagic Pro: Image to Full-Color Vector/PNG to SVG
plugins.description:
Transform your bitmap images into stunning, scalable vector graphics with the click of a button. Codia AI VectorMagic leverages advanced AI to offer a seamless transition from pixelated images to crisp, clean vectors. Perfect for designers, illustrators, and anyone looking to elevate their digital graphics.


How It Works


- PICK: Drag and drop any JPEG or PNG into the plugin. Starting with a pixel-based image, prepare to watch the magic happen.

- PROCESS: Our AI dives deep, converting your image into geometric shapes for flawless scalability. Say goodbye to blurs and hello to precision.

- DOWNLOAD: Preview the transformation, tweak if necessary, and download in SVG or PNG. Ready for any project.


Full Featured


- AI Vector Engine: Powered by the latest AI technology, combining deep learning with classical algorithms for unparalleled vectorization.

- Vector Graph: Unique computational geometry for automated edits and optimizations, achieving results beyond conventional methods.

- Full Shape Fitting & Curve Support: From Bezier curves to complex shapes, our technology ensures perfect fit and consistency.

- Clean Corners & High Performance: Meticulously crafted corners and high-speed processing for natural-looking vectors without waiting.

- Sub-Pixel Precision & Full Automation: Capturing the finest details automatically, requiring no manual input for a hassle-free experience.

- Versatile Image Types & Pre-Crop Feature: Ideal for logos, sketches, and even photographs. Maximize quality with smart cropping.

- Full Color & Transparency: Embrace the full spectrum of 32-bit color, including transparency for vibrant, true-to-life vectors.


Elevate your design workflow with Codia AI VectorMagic. Experience the future of vectorization today and bring unparalleled clarity and scalability to your digital art.

accepted.name: Codia.AI
accepted.description: Anything to Design, Anything to Code.

plugins.tagline: Seamlessly convert Pixel Images/JPG/PNG to Full-Color Vector Graphics with AI automation

plugins.name: FigNotion
plugins.description:
FigNotion is a simple plugin to add your FigJam sticky notes to a Notion database.


Move ideas into action by syncing your FigJam sticky notes with a database in Notion. This allows you to sort, filter, group, and help your team move forward. Save time by connecting Figjam to Notion using this plugin, removing the need to switch between tabs or copying/pasting data between apps.


What’s included:

  1. Export FigJam sticky notes into a Notion database.


Use cases

You can use this plugin whenever you’re working between FigJam boards and Notion databases. We have identified the following use cases to save time and help teams get back to work:


  1. Meetings: Sync your team’s actions or tasks from meetings or retrospectives back into a Notion task database.
  2. Research: Add your user research insights into a research repository database inside of Notion.
  3. Planning: Collaborate and plan your roadmaps visually in FigJam and sync them back into a structure Notion database during OKR Planning


Feature Requests

You can request a new feature, suggest an improvement or file a bug here:


+ New Feature Request


We welcome you to share any additional use cases you've identified in the comments!

accepted.name: Martin Merschroth
accepted.description: Early to the party, but my designs are the latest.

plugins.tagline: Export sticky notes from FigJam into Notion Databases

  1. Export FigJam sticky notes into a Notion database.


Use cases

You can use this plugin whenever you’re working between FigJam boards and Notion databases. We have identified the following use cases to save time and help teams get back to work:


  1. Meetings: Sync your team’s actions or tasks from meetings or retrospectives back into a Notion task database.
  2. Research: Add your user research insights into a research repository database inside of Notion.
  3. Planning: Collaborate and plan your roadmaps visually in FigJam and sync them back into a structure Notion database during OKR Planning


Feature Requests

You can request a new feature, suggest an improvement or file a bug here:


+ New Feature Request


We welcome you to share any additional use cases you've identified in the comments!
117134.release_notes: Added a simpler way to match Figma and Notion fields on the settings page, so you can see exactly how your data connects between the two tools.
117134.tagline: Export sticky notes from FigJam into Notion Databases

plugins.name: Visual Studio Code Color Mapper
plugins.description:
Create dynamic, theme responsive SVG assets for Visual Studio Code extensions.


Use the template to get started.


Automatically mapping assets


If used in conjuction with the Theme Importer for Visual Studio plugin, layers with theme variables assigned to fills or strokes will automatically be mapped to the corresponding CSS variable.


Note: all layers of a selected design must have unique names.


Manually configuring assets


Selecting a layer will show the original color value, which can be then be mapped to a Visual Studio Code theme color CSS variable of the currently selected theme.

A color can be mapped manually by selecting the variable from a searchable list, or automatically using the Wand button.

Assigned variables can be removed or replaced at any time.


A set of Visual Studio Code themes are included to help you configure layers and visualize how your assets will look in different themes. Before configuring your assets, select the theme you originally designed them for - this will ensure that the closest relevant matching variable is mapped to each layer.


Note: auto-selecting a variable will find the token with the closest color value, but its name may not always make sense semantically.

Always double-check variables before exporting to ensure each token is used in a way that is contextually understandable, ensuring correct rendering in all themes.


Exporting


After exporting you can integrate the .svg file into your Visual Studio Code extension.


Note: currently gradients are not supported.

accepted.name: Microsoft
accepted.description: The official account for Microsoft Design.

accepted.name: Lee Murray
accepted.description: Senior UX Engineer @ Microsoft

plugins.tagline: Create theme responsive SVG assets for Visual Studio Code extensions.

plugins.name: Themeable Systems
plugins.description:
Introducing Themeable, the easy way to launch a Design System with just a few clicks. 


Handcrafted by Designers for Designers, Themeable is the leading Figma app that understands your needs and challenges with design systems 


Purpose-built to enhance your design process, foster collaboration, and expedite project completion, Themeable seamlessly integrates into Figma. It's your trusty companion, empowering you with a user-friendly interface and thoughtful features. 


From the moment you start using Themeable, you'll feel the designer-centric approach. Its curated templates, components, and styles provide a solid foundation for your design system. Easily customize and adapt them to match your unique branding and requirements. 


Collaboration is at the heart of Themeable's philosophy. Say goodbye to barriers and embrace real-time collaboration with fellow designers. Work together, make updates simultaneously, and unleash creativity without limits! - Coming soon. 


Managing your design system is a breeze with Themeable. Robust version control lets you track changes, roll back if needed, and effortlessly distribute updates to your team. Stay synchronized and save valuable time and effort. 



 With Themeable, you can supercharge your productivity and focus on crafting exceptional user experiences. It's designed to address your pain points and help you work smarter. Whether it's a small project or scaling for enterprises, Themeable is your ultimate tool for streamlined workflows and outstanding results!

plugins.name: Simple 3D Viewer
plugins.description:
This open-source Figma plugin allows you to view and interact with 3D designs directly within Figma and export them.


Usage:

  1. Open Figma and go to the Plugins section.
  2. Search for "Simple 3D Viewer" and install the plugin.
  3. Open the plugin and load your 3D model to start viewing and interacting with it. (Currently, only .fbx and .obj files are supported. Other formats will be supported in the future.)
  4. Export the scene into your Figma design.


Credits:

3D designs used in UI are created by Nashekrashe Studio.


Check the GitHub repository for contributions and details.

Check out my personal website to learn more about me or get in touch (I'd be happy to see you there).

plugins.name: Instancer - Bulk generate instances from a component
plugins.description:
Instancer - Bulk generate instances from a component


Transform any Figma component/Instance/ComponentSet into a comprehensive Table showing every possible variant combination. Instancer allows you to Explore all your component states in one clear, labeled layout.


Features :


  1. Auto-Generate All Variants - Creates every possible component combination instantly
  2. Smart Property Controls - Choose which properties to include or exclude from generation
  3. Live Combination Counter - See total possible variants and nested instances at a glance
  4. Toggle-Based Filtering - Use switches to turn properties on/off for precise control
  5. Organized Matrix Layout - Clean grid arrangement makes all combinations easy to scan
  6. Clear Instance Labels - Every variant shows exactly which properties are active
  7. One-Click Generation - Select any component and generate complete variant overview instantly


Its a one-stop pit stop for reviewing design system completeness and consistency.


How to use instancer :


  1. Select any component/instance/variant from your Figma file
  2. Plugin preview window displays the selected component and shows all available properties and variants
  3. Use toggle controls to choose which properties to include in generation
  4. Click "Generate" to create your possible combination
  5. Voilà! All possible combinations are instantly created in an organized, labeled layout.


Pricing :


Free : Up to 10 free generations to explore and test the plugin.

Premium : Unlimited generations at a price of coffee.

accepted.name: Briston
accepted.description: Designer | Student | webflow

plugins.name: Node Decoder
plugins.description:
Node Decoder generates plugin or widget source code from any Figma design as Javascript and JSX. Useful for avoiding the need to code visual assets manually when developing plugins.


Generating source code


  1. Select one or more (ideally top level) layers/nodes
  2. Run the command Node Decoder
  3. Copy the generated source code
  4. Click the toggle to flip between plugin and widget code.


Previewing code


  1. Press the play icon to run the currently generated code


Plugin code


  • Selection should ideally be made at the top level
  • Doesn't support checking for custom fonts yet
  • Doesn't support images yet
  • Some frames which use Auto Layout may be slightly off because of when properties are applied


Features


  • Generates most of the source code needed to create, frames, shapes, vectors, text, groups, boolean operations, components and component sets
  • Provides syntax highlighted code which you can copy to use in your own plugin
  • Detects when text layers are present and provides a function for loading fonts before setting text properties
  • Automatically creates components needed for selection if not selected by the user
  • Automatically creates paint, effect, grid and text styles if used by nodes
  • Intelligently generates overrides for instance nodes


Widget code


  • Vectors should be in frames and have an export setting of SVG.
  • It's better to use frames than groups (for now)
  • Doesn't support images yet
  • Some nodes do not exist as React components are not supported in widget code


If you encounter any issues or have any feedback, please raise an issue at https://github.com/limitlessloop/figma-node-decoder


JavaScript API (Alpha)


An alpha version of a JavaScript API is now available to try in your own plugins. Convert any node to a string that can be recreated later.


https://github.com/limitlessloop/figma-node-decoder/tree/javascript-api

accepted.name: Gavin McFarland
accepted.description: Freelance Designer and Developer who loves making things

plugins.name: Continuous Design - Run CI from Figma
plugins.description:
Continuous Design is a Figma plugin that lets you run GitHub Actions, Bitbucket Pipelines, and Azure DevOps Pipelines from Figma.


If you want to practice "continuous design" using Figma and a modern development toolchain, it may be time to start deploying design changes straight from Figma!


Prerequisites

You will need:

  • An account with your provider
  • A pre-existing repository with your provider
  • A pre-existing CI workflow:
  • For a GitHub Actions reference, see my repo github-ci-demo. Note that you have to allow Actions to be run in the repo for this to work! Please also see how the workflow and  workflow_dispatch is defined to better understand your setup needs.
  • For a GitLab reference, see my repo gitlab-ci-demo.
  • For a Bitbucket Pipelines reference, see my repo bitbucket-ci-demo.
  • For an Azure DevOps Pipelines reference, see my repo azure-devops-ci-demo.
  • A means of authentication:
  • GitHub: A personal access token (with "repo" scope"). You can create one at https://github.com/settings/tokens. If you are stuck, follow the instructions at GitHub.
  • Bitbucket: An application password. You can create one at https://bitbucket.org/account/settings/app-passwords/. More instructions here.
  • Azure: A personal access token. Instructions here.


Permissions and data collection

Depending on your provider, you will need either a personal access token or an application password. These are are the accepted ways of handling plugins and other external tooling in the GitHub/Bitbucket/Azure DevOps contexts.


The plugin itself never sends this information anywhere other than to call the respective provider APIs.


You can however decide to store the state of all fields privately within Figma. Doing so stores the current state (including the PAT value) in Figma's contained asyncStorage (essentially a sandboxed localStorage).


Using the plugin

Given that you have the prerequisites under control, it's just a matter of filling out the fields.


The strictly necessary fields to get a success response are:

- Personal access token/Application password: Your token or password from GitHub/Bitbucket/Azure.

- User name: Your user name.

- Repository name: Your repository name as it appears in a typical URL.

- Workflow name [GitHub only: Has to be specified in the style of `filename.yml`. Defaults to `main.yml`.

- Organization name [Bitbucket only]: Your organization's name (might also be called "workspace").

- Definition ID [Azure only]: The seemingly random (?) ID that each pipeline receives. The easiest way to get it is to navigate to your pipeline in the Azure DevOps web console and check the URL bar which should look like: `https://dev.azure.com/YOUR_USER/YOUR_PROJECT/_build?definitionId=16`.

- Branch: Should be same as the branch you want to trigger. Defaults to `main`.


The optional fields are:

- Message: Can be used to provide the CI workflow some context on what's changed.

- Version: Can be used to provide the CI workflow information on a version. See the below example for how this can be used with—for example—Figmagic to pull data from a given version of your Figma document.


You will receive a popup/alert that informs you that the workflow is starting/failing.

accepted.name: Mikael Vesavuori
accepted.description: Technical Standards Lead at Polestar

plugins.tagline: Run CI from Figma

plugins.name: Phrase TMS
plugins.description:
At Phrase, we’re transforming language technology, opening the door to global business so you can reach more people, make deeper connections, and drive growth.

Our comprehensive suite of translation tools is intuitive to use and simple to integrate so you can focus on forming deeper connections with people across cultures.

 

Figma + Phrase TMS

Bring design and localization closer together with the Phrase TMS integration for Figma.

 

Seamless localization

 There’s no need to leave your Figma account to create translation projects in Phrase TMS. Send your designs for translation in just a few clicks, then seamlessly pull translations from Phrase TMS back to Figma when complete.

 

Easily test localized designs

Use the pseudo-translate feature to validate translations in the design phase. Pseudotranslation simulates what your localized text will look like, allowing designers to get an early indication of how translations fit the design, reducing feedback loops. 

 

Save time and money

Translation memories within Phrase TMS will automatically store all past translations and allow you to reuse them wherever possible, making for faster, cheaper, and more consistent localization. Updating copy in Figma? Sync updated translations to translation memories in Phrase TMS, without leaving Figma. 

 

Leverage state of the art machine translation

Speed up the localization process, without sacrificing quality. Phrase TMS integrates with over 30 MT engines and automatically selects the optimal MT engine for every content piece.

 

Set up

The plugin requires Phrase TMS Ultimate or Enterprise plan. Get in touch with Sales for licensing questions. 

 

Installing the plugin is quick and easy. Visit the Phrase TMS Figma Plugin page for more information.

accepted.description: The fastest and easiest way possible to start translating your Figma designs. Phrase is a translation management solution built with the whole team in mind.

plugins.name: CSS variables import/export
plugins.description:
Copy, export, or import your local Figma variables into CSS variables format.


Each collection is split up into modes and these are printed as "root:" groups in the CSS output.


This allows you to restructure the output into your preferred code format.


There are 3 tabs in the Export tab:

  1. All variables – Print all of your local variables in CSS variables format
  2. Cherry pick – Pick two collections to print. For example, a primitive and semantic collection
  3. All local variables – Each collection is shown as a scrollable table


And 2 tabs in the Import tab:

  1. Paste CSS – copy from your file and paste CSS variables, then import them as Figma variables
  2. Upload File – Drag and drop a CSS file into the plugin to generate your variables, including aliases

plugins.name: Variables Translator
plugins.description:
Variables Translator allows you to translate your text content stored in a collection, thanks to the latest feature: Variables. The plugin will enable you to create a new mode containing the translation of each of your String variables into the language of your choice.


How to start?

After downloading the plugin, create a collection to store your text content, including as many string variables as necessary. For example, if you're managing the content of a modal, create variables such as "Modal/title," "Modal/subtitle," and "Modal/cta.”


Learn more about Variables ↗︎


How to use the plugin?

Launch the plugin, and you'll see 3 fields:

1. Collection to Translate

2. Input Language

3. Output Language


You can use the Collection to Translate field to select the collection containing the content you want to translate. Note that only collections with String type variables will be displayed.


The Input Language field allows you to choose the starting language of your content. This will always be the first Mode created in your collection.


Finally, the Output Language field lets you select the language in which you want to translate your content. A new Mode will be created and named according to the chosen language.
